445.ds: The Barracks houses your troops and increases your city’s army size. It also boosts the enlistment speed of adjacent military buildings. Shortkey: B

446.ds: Cabins provide housing for peasants, which increase the construction speed of all your city’s buildings. Cabins also increase the productivity of any resource gathering buildings adjacent to them. Shortkey: C

447.ds: Farms grow crops in adjacent fields, producing Food for your troops. Place Farms next to Lake resources, empty fields, Cabins or a Grain Mill to increase their output.  Shortkey: A

448.ds: Forester's Huts increase your Wood production. Place Forester's Huts next to Wood resources, Cabins or a Sawmill to increase their output. Shortkey: F

449.ds: The Forum allows you to trade with other players. Use the Forum to arrange for the transport of resources to other cities by land, via carts. Place a Villa next to a Forum to boost the Villa’s taxes.  Shortkey: M

451.ds: This is a Stone Resource Node. Place a Stone Mine beside it to increase your city's stone production.

452.ds: This is an Iron Resource Node. Place an Iron Mine beside it to increase your city's iron production.

453.ds: This is a Lake Resource Node. Place a Farm Estate beside it to increase your city's food production.

454.ds: This is a Forest Resource Node. Place a Forester's Hut beside it to increase your city's wood production.

455.ds: At the centre of your city is the Basilica, which stores some of your resources and produces Wood. Increase the number of buildings you can add to your city by upgrading the Basilica. It cannot be totally destroyed, and only one Basilica can be built per city.

460.ds: Sawmills boost the output of bordering Forester's Huts and increase the Wood storage capacity of any bordering Storehouses. Shortkey: L

461.ds: Stone Mines increase your Stone production. Place Stone Mines next to Stone resources, Cabins or a Mason’s Hut to increase their output. Shortkey: S

462.ds: Mason’s Huts boost the output of bordering Stone Mines and increase the Stone storage capacity of any bordering Storehouses. Shortkey: H

463.ds: Grain Mills boost the output of bordering Farm Estates and increase the Food storage capacity of any bordering Storehouses. Shortkey: G

464.ds: Storehouses store your resources, increasing your city’s maximum storage capacity. Increase the amount a storehouse can hold by placing it next to Sawmills, Mason’s Huts, Grain Mills or Smelters. Shortkey: R

465.ds: Iron Mines increase your Iron production. Place Iron Mines next to Iron resources, Cabins or a Smelter to increase their output.  Shortkey: I

466.ds: Building a Stable will allow you to enlist Cavalry units. Upgrade your Stable to increase its unit enlistment rate. Place Stables next to a Barracks to boost your city’s Cavalry enlistment rate.  Shortkey: E

467.ds: Building a Castle allows you to plunder, assault, siege and conquer other cities, but it also makes your own city vulnerable to attacks from other players. Building a Castle will exponentially increase the maximum army size of your city, and is an irreversible action. Shortkey: X

477.ds: Smelters boost the output of bordering Iron Mines and increase the Iron storage capacity of any bordering Storehouses. Shortkey: Z

479.ds: Hideaways allow you to store resources safely, and they cannot be plundered or included in any Scout Reports. Increase the capacity of your Hideaway by placing it next to woodland.  Shortkey: Q

481.ds: Building a Villa allows you to collect taxes in the form of Gold from your city. Place a Villa next to Forums and Ports to increase Gold production. Shortkey: V

482.ds: Building an Academy will allow you to enlist Senators and Sacred Units. Upgrade your Academy to increase its unit enlistment rate. Place an Academy next to a Barracks to boost your city’s Sacred enlistment rate.  Shortkey: Y

483.ds: Building a Training Arena will allow you to enlist Infantry units. Upgrade your Training Arena to increase its unit enlistment rate. Place a Training Arena next to a Barracks to boost your city’s Infantry enlistment rate. Shortkey: T

488.ds: Ports create Trading Ships that move resources between cities and allow you to trade with other players by sea. Place a Villa next to a Port to boost the Villa’s taxes. Shortkey: O

489.ds: Ports create Trading Ships that move resources between cities and allow you to trade with other players by sea. Place a Villa next to a Port to boost the Villa’s taxes. Shortkey: O

490.ds: Ports create Trading Ships that move resources between cities and allow you to trade with other players by sea. Place a Villa next to a Port to boost the Villa’s taxes. Shortkey: O

491.ds: Building a Shipyard will allow you to enlist Naval units. Upgrade your Shipyard to increase its unit enlistment rate. Place a Shipyard next to a Barracks to boost your city’s Naval enlistment rate. Shortkey: P

496.ds: Building a Shipyard will allow you to enlist Naval units. Upgrade your Shipyard to increase its unit enlistment rate. Place a Shipyard next to a Barracks to boost your city’s Naval enlistment rate. Shortkey: P

498.ds: Building a Shipyard will allow you to enlist Naval units. Upgrade your Shipyard to increase its unit enlistment rate. Place a Shipyard next to a Barracks to boost your city’s Naval enlistment rate. Shortkey: P

500.ds: Building a Sorcerer’s Tower will allow you to enlist Mystic units. Upgrade your Sorcerer’s Tower to increase its unit enlistment rate. Place a Sorcerer’s Tower next to a Barracks to boost your city’s Mystic enlistment rate. At level 10 the Sorcerer's Tower allows you to Refine resources.  Shortkey: W

502.ds: Building a Blacksmith will allow you to enlist Artillery. Upgrade your Blacksmith to increase its unit enlistment rate. Place a Blacksmith next to a Barracks to boost your city’s Artillery enlistment rate. Shortkey: K

504.ds: Building a Guard House will allow you to enlist Guard Units. Upgrade your Guard House to increase its Guard enlistment rate. Guard numbers and enlistment speeds are not dependent on Barracks. Shortkey: U

539.ds: The Triari Post increases the defensive abilities of a limited number of Triari by 100%, when the city is attacked by enemy units. Each Triari can be replaced by one Guard if there are not enough Triari to fill the Triari Post. Shortkey: 3

540.ds: The Triari Post increases the defensive abilities of a limited number of Triari by 100%, when the city is attacked by enemy units. Each Triari can be replaced by one Guard if there are not enough Triari to fill the Triari Post. Shortkey: 3

541.ds: The Triari Post increases the defensive abilities of a limited number of Triari by 100%, when the city is attacked by enemy units. Each Triari can be replaced by one Guard if there are not enough Triari to fill the Triari Post. Shortkey: 3

543.ds: The Ranger Post increases the defensive abilities of a limited number of Rangers by 100%, when the city is attacked by enemy units. Each Ranger can be replaced by one Guard if there are not enough Rangers to fill the Ranger Post.  Shortkey: 2

544.ds: The Ranger Post increases the defensive abilities of a limited number of Rangers by 100%, when the city is attacked by enemy units. Each Ranger can be replaced by one Guard if there are not enough Rangers to fill the Ranger Post.  Shortkey: 2

545.ds: The Ranger Post increases the defensive abilities of a limited number of Rangers by 100%, when the city is attacked by enemy units. Each Ranger can be replaced by one Guard if there are not enough Rangers to fill the Ranger Post.  Shortkey: 2

546.ds: The Ranger Post increases the defensive abilities of a limited number of Rangers by 100%, when the city is attacked by enemy units. Each Ranger can be replaced by one Guard if there are not enough Rangers to fill the Ranger Post.  Shortkey: 2

547.ds: The Sentinel Post increases your range of vision, giving you early warning of incoming attacks. It also increases the defensive abilities of a limited number of Scouts by 100%. Each Scout slot can be replaced by two Guards if there are not enough Scouts to fill the Sentinel Post. Shortkey: 1

548.ds: The Sentinel Post increases your range of vision, giving you early warning of incoming attacks. It also increases the defensive abilities of a limited number of Scouts by 100%. Each Scout slot can be replaced by two Guards if there are not enough Scouts to fill the Sentinel Post. Shortkey: 1

549.ds: The Sentinel Post increases your range of vision, giving you early warning of incoming attacks. It also increases the defensive abilities of a limited number of Scouts by 100%. 551.ds: The Priestess Post increases the defensive abilities of a limited number of Priestesses by 100%, when the city is attacked by enemy units. Each Priestess can be replaced by one Guard if there are not enough Priestesses to fill the Priestess Post. Shortkey: 4

555.ds: The Ballista Post increases the defensive abilities of a limited number of Ballista by 100%, when the city is attacked by enemy units. Each Ballista can be replaced by ten Guards if there are not enough Ballista to fill the Ballista Post. Shortkey: 5

556.ds: The Ballista Post increases the defensive abilities of a limited number of Ballista by 100%, when the city is attacked by enemy units. Each Ballista can be replaced by ten Guards if there are not enough Ballista to fill the Ballista Post. Shortkey: 5

559.ds: The Equine Barricade repels a limited number of enemy cavalry units attacking your city, so that they do no damage. A maximum of 50% of enemy cavalry units can be affected. Shortkey: 7

560.ds: The Equine Barricade repels a limited number of enemy cavalry units attacking your city, so that they do no damage. A maximum of 50% of enemy cavalry units can be affected. Shortkey: 7

571.ds: The Veiled Barricade repels a limited number of enemy artillery units attacking your city, so they do no damage. A maximum of 50% of enemy artillery units can be affected. Shortkey: 9

809.ds: A City Wall surrounds your city, which cannot be completely destroyed. It increases your land units’ defence against attack.
